raw_data.title: Cloud Application and Data Developer (Senior)
raw_data.description: Services performed include, but are not limited to leading the design, development, and implementation of cloud-based applications and data solutions. This role involves working closely with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, design solutions, and ensure the successful deployment of applications in a cloud environment. Cloud Application Development responsibilities includes, design, develop, and deploy scalable cloud-based applications. Utilize cloud platforms such as AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud to build and manage application services. Implement microservices architecture and containerization technologies like Docker and Kubernetes. Data Management and Integration includes,  develop and implement strategies for data storage, data integration, and data migration to cloud platforms. Ensure data integrity and security across all cloud environments. Design and manage databases, data warehouses, and data lakes. Performance Optimization includes, monitor and optimize the performance, scalability, and cost-efficiency of cloud applications. Implement best practices for cloud architecture and DevOps to enhance application performance and reliability. Conduct regular performance tuning and optimization of cloud resources. Security and Compliance includes, ensure compliance with security policies and regulations in the cloud environment. Implement and manage security measures such as encryption, IAM, and network security. Conduct regular security audits and vulnerability assessments. Collaboration and Leadership includes, lead and mentor junior developers and engineers in best practices for cloud application development and data management. Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, requirements, and deliverables. Provide technical leadership and guidance throughout the project lifecycle. Continuous Improvement includes, stay updated with the latest trends and advancements in cloud computing and data technologies. Evaluate and recommend new tools, technologies, and processes to improve development efficiency and application performance. Participate in code reviews and contribute to the continuous improvement of coding standards and practices.

Assists in the collection and analysis of threat intelligence, security event data, and log files to detect potential cybersecurity incidents or anomalous behavior. Participates in security assessments, incident response activities, and baseline security configuration reviews under guidance from senior analysts. Consults with users to identify current operating procedures, problems, and requirements. Documents installation, maintenance, and operating procedures. May create coding and logic specifications for developers. This is an entry-level position intended to build foundational expertise across one or more HACS service areas such as Risk and Vulnerability Assessments, Cyber Hunt, and Incident Response.
